data.title: Luke Wehner on LinkedIn: Data Science Manager Alexa Myers Recognized with Tech 25 Award
data.meta_description: Couldn’t think of anyone who deserves this award more. So honored I get to work with you, Alexa Myers. You’re one of the best people leaders I’ve been around…
data.text:
🌟 Bridging Data and Health: My Debut Machine Learning Triumph in Vaccine Usage Prediction! 🚀 Hello, remarkable LinkedIn community! 👋 I'm elated to share a pivotal moment in my data-driven journey – my maiden venture into the captivating world of machine learning, fueled by a burning passion to predict vaccine usage. 🎉 💉 Project Illumination: Predicting Vaccine Usage In a world where data holds the power to transform lives, my focus has converged on healthcare. Armed with machine learning prowess, I've embarked on a mission to predict vaccine usage patterns. By deciphering the complexities of variables like awareness, health conditions, recommendations, and more, I'm unveiling insights that have the potential to reshape public health strategies. 🦠 Unveiling Insights for a Healthier Future ✅ Data-Driven Precision: Through meticulous analysis, I've harnessed the wealth of datasets to unlock patterns that resonate with vaccine behavior. Each variable, each data point, contributes to the grand narrative of health and decision-making. ✅ Algorithmic Ingenuity: With a symphony of algorithms, I've orchestrated a predictive model that learns from historical trends and generalizes for an even broader impact. This model serves as a beacon of precision in an ever-evolving healthcare landscape. ✅ Empowering Public Health: This endeavor transcends beyond prediction; it's about equipping healthcare professionals, policymakers, and individuals with insights that have the power to bolster vaccine acceptance, enhance public health strategies, and contribute to a more resilient society. 💉 Charting the Data-Health Nexus In an era where data drives innovation, this project isn't just about predicting vaccine usage – it's about reshaping the dialogue between data and health. It's about arming decision-makers with insights that transcend boundaries, fostering healthier communities and safeguarding our collective well-being. 🔗Github link: https://lnkd.in/dmtBVDGY 🌟 🚀 Looking forward to joining the army of data professionals who can make an impact on the healthcare industry. #DataScience #HealthcareAnalytics #MachineLearning #VaccineUsagePrediction #PublicHealth #DataDrivenInsights

Hello! 😊 I'm excited to share a project that holds personal significance for me. 💡Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) affects approximately 1 in 10 women of childbearing age, yet many remain undiagnosed. 🤎The objective of this project is to explore how Machine Learning models can play a role in the early detection of PCOS symptoms in women. 🤍I opted to work with a Logistic Regression Model, achieving a noteworthy 79.8% accuracy among other results. The potential here is significant, offering a step towards more proactive healthcare for those affected. 💡Feel free to check out the project through the GitHub file linked below. I invite your valuable suggestions, insights, and corrections where necessary. https://lnkd.in/de8PuWrv Let's engage in a conversation on the intersection of data science and healthcare and how we can collectively contribute to addressing health challenges. #DataScience #HealthTech #PCOSDetection #MachineLearning #HealthcareInnovation #businessjourneyer I look forward to your input! 💡 🌏

🚀 Day 21 of #75DaysMLChallenge 🩺 Hey LinkedIn community! 👋 Today's journey led me to the heart of data—literally! 🏥📊 Exploring a captivating healthcare dataset was nothing short of a revelation. Here's a sneak peek into the day's adventures: 🌐 Project Spotlight: Healthcare Dataset 🌡️ Diving into the vast sea of healthcare data, I deciphered patterns, identified trends, and unleashed the potential to transform patient outcomes. 💉💻 The intersection of #DataScience and healthcare holds the key to a healthier future! 🚀 🛠️ Key Highlights: Cleaned and processed intricate healthcare data. Unveiled insights that can redefine patient care. Explored the synergy between technology and healthcare for impactful solutions. 🌟 Why Healthcare + Data Science? The power to improve lives lies in the data we analyze. Leveraging machine learning in healthcare is not just a challenge—it's a responsibility. Let's harness the potential of data for a healthier world! 💪🌐 🙌 Join the Conversation: I invite fellow data enthusiasts, healthcare professionals, and everyone passionate about making a difference to join this conversation. Share your thoughts, insights, and let's collaborate for a brighter, healthier future! 🤝 🚀 Spread the Word: If you believe in the transformative power of data in healthcare, hit that like button, share your thoughts in the comments, and let's make this post go viral! 🌐👍 Together, we can amplify the impact of data-driven solutions in healthcare. 🌟 #DataForGood #HealthTech #DataScience #75DaysMLChallenge #HealthcareData 🚀 https://lnkd.in/dvXUvsSS

Healthcare is a field that desperately needs data talent 🆘 It's a space that not only has a shortage of data professionals, but also has been making major investments in data initiatives And it makes sense--there are VAST amounts of data being generated everyday and they come in the form of clinical, insurance, pharmaceutical, behavioral and public health data So for those looking to land their first data role, those who already have a data role but are trying to niche down into a specific field, or those with data skills who just want to make a real world impact but don't know where to begin, boy do I have the perfect learning opportunity for you. Health Universe, Inc is hosting a hackathon that will be going on until August 31, where your mission is to deploy a health app on Health Universe, which is an AI cloud platform built for researchers, data scientists and clinicians 🥇 1st Place winners win $5,000 🥈 2nd Place win $3,000 🥉 3rd Place win $2,000 So you get to win money while gaining practical experience that will help you break into one of the hottest industries in data?? Sounds like a win-win to me 🙌 For details on how to enter the challenge before it closes soon, check out the link in my comments below 👇 #healthcare #healthcareanalytics #data Big thank you to Health Universe, Inc for partnering with me to allow me to invite my audience to this exciting event 🙏

The NIH AD/ADRD platforms workshop this Summer was a fantastic discussion over two days. It was so stimulating, I wished we had met in person. Jennie Larkin led with Lara Mangravite & Stan Ahalt as co-chairs and a wonderful, engaged group of speakers & attendees. FAIRness across data ecosystems was a focus, in that spirit NIA has made all materials findable and accessible (https://lnkd.in/eKq4et5Z). There is a detailed summary of all sessions (3 page exec summary & 30 pages deep-dive) on that page. I chaired the Current NIH Ecosystems session featuring the Cancer Research Data Commons (Tanja Davidsen), Common Fund Data Ecosystem (George Papanicolaou), National COVID Cohort Collaborative (Ken Gersing, MD), Analysis, Visualization, & Informatics Lab-space (Michael Schatz), and BioData Catalyst (Regina Bures). Great overviews of each ecosystem plus a thoughtful panel exploring some hard questions. We didn't solve all the problems those two days, but my key take-aways (**views my own**, not speaking on behalf of NIH or anyone else): • Data ecosystems are an amazing force multiplier for engaged researchers. As a community we still need to reach a larger, more diverse community - these platforms can do even more and we know collaboration advances science. Engagement & training are key. • Data science is evolving rapidly, it's critical that we continue investment in interoperability (e.g. APIs, global community standards) such that we empower current and future scientists to leverage the information they need to answer challenging questions. • Policy and Technology advances will be most impactful if they are approached synergistically. Feedback loops help both "sides" achieve their goals efficiently. If policy and technology development get out of sync, there can be long delays as one catches up to the other. • Data engineering is hard, there remains no free lunch... We should invest in data engineering so data scientists can build on that foundation. We should not ask each data scientist to spend 85% of their time re-engineering data. • Sustainability is paramount, we need to optimize investments in science while continuing to build trust with the research community that ecosystems will support their needs. • Ultimately, results all external and across different institutions we want to improve health - to give patients & families more options and more time. This requires continued investment in academia to advance the science, build datasets and cutting edge tools. However, we need to also invest in translational research - continuing to bring biotechs, pharmas, & health systems into the fold. https://lnkd.in/eVBZzKzm
